Legislation to make course titles uniform at Commonwealth Campuses and University Park will be one of the issues addressed at the University Faculty Senate meeting today PERIOD

Faculty Senate Chair Kim Steiner said this could be a difficult subject because course abbreviations are used differently throughout Commonwealth Campuses to help prevent instances of   credit from courses at Commonwealth Campuses not transferring toward majors at University Park PERIOD It also refers to courses containing similar material not being recognized because of different course numbers PERIOD

Members will also vote on legislation proposing to revise the Senate policies relating to reenrollment reinstatement and academic renewal of students which is an academic forgiveness policy that resets a students grade point average to zero PERIOD The proposed policy change aims to make all of these processes easier for students and to assure effective academic advising PERIOD Reasons for faculty dismissal will also be discussed at todays Senate meeting PERIOD

Members will examine whether the term  is an acceptable cause for dismissal Steiner said PERIOD All the cases of this type of dismissal are confidential and no formal case study has been conducted he added PERIOD

John Bagby chair of the subcommittee on faculty rights and privacy issues said a report will be presented to inform the Senate on the important issue of faculty dismissal and to initiate discussion PERIOD

Interest in clarifying charges may have been sparked from Nona Gerard a faculty member in Altoona who was dismissed on March   he said PERIOD

Gerard was dismissed for  and  after the tenured professor allegedly wrote email messages criticizing the integrative arts program PERIOD

There will also be an informational report with suggestions on textbook selection PERIOD The report acknowledges the increasing textbook prices and urges faculty to take the rises into consideration when selecting textbooks for classes PERIOD

The Senate meeting is open to the public and will take place at  p.m PERIOD today in  Kern Building PERIOD
